introduction: You can fill in a form on the HM Revenue & Customs website to get a new Child Trust Fund voucher if yours has been lost or stolen.
more_information:
You **can’t** use this service if any of the following apply:

* your original voucher has expired 
* your original voucher was lost or stolen more than a year ago
* your child's name or address has changed
* you are claiming a European family benefit 

You'll need to call the Child Trust Fund Helpline.

$C
**Child Trust Fund Helpline**  
0845 302 1470
$C

###If your name isn’t on a Child Benefit award notice
If you have [parental responsibility](/parental-rights-responsibilities "parental rights and responsibilities") for a child but your name isn’t on their Child Benefit award notice, you’ll need to [use the 'parental responsibility' form](https://online.hmrc.gov.uk/shortforms/form/CTF_Replacement_Voucher_PR_Person?dept-name=CTF&sub-dept-name=&location=6&origin=http://www.hmrc.gov.uk "Child Trust Fund - Request for a replacement voucher by person with parental responsibility"){:rel="external"} to get a replacement voucher. 

The replacement voucher will be sent to the person who gets Child Benefit for the child.

title: Apply for a replacement Child Trust Fund voucher
